candidates.title: release: bump crate versions needed for aqc release
candidates.body: Bump crate versions to release aranya-core crates needed by the upcoming AQC release.

candidates.title: aranya-crypto: clean up dependencies
candidates.body:
We were importing both postcard and ciborium, which was overkill. Choose ciborium since CBOR is a standard and postcard is "just" some library.

This also lets us get rid of `MaxSize`, which we didn't really use. That will help us get rid of some duplicate dependencies in later PRs.

candidates.title: Use errno crate
candidates.body: Note it was already in our dependency tree. https://crates.io/crates/errno

candidates.title: chore: rolling release
candidates.body: Fixes #242

candidates.title: capi: make opaque types an exact size and alignment
candidates.body:
The opaque macro now serves two functions. It first wraps the original type in the `Opaque` wrapper. Then it applies the `[u8; SIZE]` representation to the generated renamed type that cbindgen sees.

Closes #227.

candidates.title: crypto: pair PSKs with cipher suites
candidates.body: Fixes #237

candidates.title: chore: Rolling Release 2025-04-21
candidates.body: Creates a new release with the latest aranya-core changes. The two main changes are allowing for listing Graph IDs, and struct subselection support.

candidates.title: chore: fix vet config and remove unused path dep versions
candidates.body:
Fixes `cargo vet` check: https://github.com/aranya-project/aranya-core/actions/runs/14389133920/job/40351787630

Removes `version` from `path` dependencies in crates that have not been published and from `dev-dependencies`.

candidates.title: aqc: release crypto & ffi crates
candidates.body:
Release AQC crypto & ffi crates.

Generated this PR with:
`release-plz update`

There's a good chance there could be breaking changes that weren't caught by the tool.

AQC crypto & ffi PR where changes are that are being released (plus whatever else changed on the `main` branch since the last release):
https://github.com/aranya-project/aranya-core/pull/184

candidates.title: aranya-capi-codegen: Apply `#[cfg()]` Attributes To FFI Wrapper
candidates.body: Since we're making AFC experimental, some types are now conditionally defined, which causes errors in our FFI wrapper since the type path doesn't exist. This should fix that by copying the same `#[cfg()]` flags over.

candidates.title: Security updates
candidates.body:
- Update `rcgen` and use aws crypto for it and `s2n-quic` instead of `ring`
  - `ring`'s https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2025-0009 required updating `rcgen`, which now has a flag for choosing aws crypto, so I switched off `ring` entirely.
- Update `scc` and `sdd` off yanked versions.
- Allow https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2024-0436.html
  - it doesn't seem problematic and has no easy migration at the moment.

candidates.title: use `buggy` instead of `aranya-buggy`
candidates.body: Fixes #80

candidates.title: remove `aranya-crypto-core` and `aranya-crypto-derive`
candidates.body:
Fixes #63 
Updates #82

candidates.title: Fix git-unchanged check and fix lockfile
candidates.body: `cargo-make` uses `sh` by default, which accepts bash-isms on our Mac dev machines, but not in CI. Since the problem was in an `if`, it just got always skipped from `[[ not found`.

candidates.title: Migrate Errors to `thiserror`
candidates.body: Migrates the majority of errors to `thiserror`, save for the places where it doesn't make sense (mostly more complex ErrorKind-type errors and macros). Solves #71.

candidates.title: crypto: use ChaCha8 instead of AES-CTR for `trng` CSPRNG
candidates.body: Fixes #40

candidates.title: crypto: move low level crypto into `aranya-crypto-core`
candidates.body:
This PR attempts to keep `aranya-crypto`'s APIs the same by re-exporting types, etc. Future PRs will start to pare back `aranya-crypto`.

Fixes #33

candidates.title: #15: Publish multiple commands
candidates.body:
- The VM now `Yield`s to the  runtime when it publishes a command. The runtime is responsible for sealing the command, updating the facts database, then resuming the VM so it can process the next command.
- FFI `call`s now take an immutable self.
